channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Donald Trump suspends immigration into US for 60 days, Australian death toll stands at 74 as global COVID-19 cases exceed 2.5 million

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: parliament sits to consider emergency laws

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: Education editor Jordan Baker joins Tory Maguire to talk through the NSW government's staggered return-to-classroom plan and its mixed messages for parents and teachers across Australia.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: when can the kids go back to school?

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: For inspiration during self-isolation, we've asked prominent Australian artists and entertainers to tell us what they are doing at home.
item.title: Home Sweet Home: what's keeping actor Ursula Yovich busy in isolation

item.description: The leaders of tennis' governing bodies announced the creation of a relief fund to help lower-ranked players weather the crisis created by the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Relief fund coming for lower-ranked tennis players

item.description: Nova Scotia Premier Stephen McNeil said the province had not received a request from police for an emergency alert to be sent out.
item.title: Mounties under fire for using Twitter as emergency alert

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Police decided to go into the unit about six hours into the siege and officers found the residence empty upon entering.
item.title: Axe-wielding man escapes from police after Gold Coast unit siege

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: The Greens 15,000 members has begun voting on whether they will be given a direct voice in the election of future leaders.
item.title: Old Greens wounds reopen as members vote on directly electing leader

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Panic buying of food and toilet paper helped drive retail sales growth to a record high last month but economists warn a heavy slump could lie ahead.
item.title: Australians spent extra $2.7 billion stocking pantries in March

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Private patients who require elective surgery will be pushed to the bottom of a waiting list as an unintended consequence of the Andrews government 'purchasing' private hospital beds to deal with the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Private patients forced to bottom of elective surgery waiting list

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A senior Liberal backbencher says converting investor loans to interest-only would free up money for the borrowers to cover falling rental incomes.
item.title: Protect property market with interest-only investor loans: Liberal MP

item.dc:creator: Sarah Berry
item.description: Promotion of so-called ‘healthy’ alcohol is on the rise. But can getting tipsy ever be a health remedy - even if it is organic?
item.title: 'Healthy' booze with benefits: is it too good to be true?

item.description: In an industry whose guiding ethos is “move fast and break things”, it usually takes some kind of tech wreck before the big online companies will act in the interest of their users’ safety.
item.title: Zoombombing's only the tip of the COVID-19 scam iceberg

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Malcolm Turnbull's publisher has sent legal warnings to scores of people within the federal government over the former PM's new memoir.
item.title: Turnbull's publisher settles with Morrison adviser as it continues copyright pursuit

item.description: On Sydney's Dangar Island, home cooks are finding ways to stay connected during the COVID-19 lockdown.
item.title: A moving feast: our corona cook-up could go viral

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The 20-year-old woman was part of the group at the scene and police want to speak to her as part of the investigation.
item.title: Police search for woman after fatal Gold Coast street stabbing

item.description: Offered by the billionaire businessman as collateral for a bail-out, Necker Island has a reputation for powerful partying.
item.title: My trip to Necker Island, Branson's luxury hideaway

item.description: St Vincent's Hospital opens a Covid-19 test in Darlinghurst, East Sydney.
item.title: Covid-19 clinic opens in East Sydney

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: Wisetech reaffirmed its FY20 revenue and earnings guidance on Wednesday but will put discretionary spending on hold along with its controversial acquisition strategy.
item.title: WiseTech confirms guidance and puts acquisitions on hold

item.description: Former St Kilda forward Arryn Siposs was at his home in Auburn, Alabama the other day when his phone rang. He's glad he picked up.
item.title: Call 'came out of the blue': Interest in former Saint ahead of NFL draft

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Last week, fuel sellers in major regional centres were making an average of 49 cents per litre, compared to 15 cents per litre during the same week in 2019.
item.title: Are West Australians being gouged at the bowser?

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: NSW Rugby League has eased fears more than 100,000 community players would miss an entire season due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Back in the game: Grassroots rugby league in NSW poised for July return

item.description: Prince Harry's wife is suing the Mail on Sunday over the publication of a handwritten letter to her father.
item.title: Ever wondered how Harry and Meghan are funded? Court case will tell

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: Western Australia did not record any new infections with coronavirus overnight, with only two cases registered in the past four days, Premier Mark McGowan announced today at a press briefing.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: No new cases for WA an 'outstanding result', Premier Mark McGowan says

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: Results aren't all that matter to the former Socceroos boss. Instead, he is constantly thinking of his late father.
item.title: 'Would he enjoy watching this?': How Ange Postecoglou measures success

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The victim and her paedophile father both separately picked the man out of a line-up of 12 men – but neither could say for sure he was the man who raped her.
item.title: Accused ninth member of 'Evil 8' paedophile ring found not guilty

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: The plans for school buildings up to six levels were approved despite concerns there would not be enough open space for nearly 2000 students.
item.title: $123 million 'vertical' Sydney school to be built in town centre

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: Griffin gives us a little theatrical hit while still flattening the curve.
item.title: Jordan Raskopoulos review: A Hydra to rattle the bars of our cages

item.description: Seven sources, representing both sides of the country's deep political divide, say allies to President Nicolas Maduro and rival Juan Guaido are in talks.
item.title: Insiders say virus may provide answer to Venezuela's political crisis

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Stamp duty revenue is set to slide almost 10 per cent as property sales plummet amid a 'catastrophic' outlook for the Victorian economy.
item.title: 'Tough set of numbers': Housing sales slump to hit government coffers

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: A Perth woman convicted of being an accessory to the murder of her mother – whose death became known as the ‘body-in-the-suitcase mystery' – has walked free from prison.
item.title: Daughter of 'body-in-suitcase' murder victim walks free after three years jail

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The expert is expected to go through the 13 critical fibres found in Bradley Edwards' old work car after it was seized from its new owner in late 2016.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: ChemCentre expert details clues found in accused's old work car 20 years after murders

item.dc:creator: Stephen A Russell
item.description: When singer and actor Adam Noviello had all his work cancelled almost overnight, he pulled together a cabaret night to raise money for out-of-work artists.
item.title: Musical talents join forces for charity cabaret

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: A team could continue playing in quarantine hubs even if one of its players tests positive for COVID-19 under an early proposal related to testing outlined by the AFL to clubs on Tuesday.
item.title: AFL teams could play on in hubs even if player tests positive

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Police are ramping up their public appeal for information about missing campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay, who disappeared in the high country a month ago.
item.title: 'The bush can swallow you up': Police baffled by campers' disappearance

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Riley Wilson
item.description: We have the time now to pause and reflect on how we’ve been living, but more importantly to decide what we'll prioritise once all this is over.
item.title: Together, separately: how will we grow from this period of solitude?

item.description: "We have not seen a crisis like this for over a hundred years": Every tenth company boss surveyed wasn't sure whether his business can survive the pandemic.
item.title: No quick recovery: Global CEOs see U-shaped recession due to COVID-19

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.dc:creator: Lissa Christopher
item.description: The COVID-19 shutdown has staff and students improvising heavily this semester and sharing their efforts on Instagram.
item.title: National Art School students get creative in lockdown

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: WA Labor politician Dave Kelly has hit out at the handling by the Christian Brothers of child sex allegations against a now-deceased brother who taught him at CBC Fremantle.
item.title: WA Labor minister hits out at handling of 'terrifying' alleged child sex abuser

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Head of COVID business taskforce is urging state and federal governments to pursue tax, regulation changes that will deliver 'immediate kicks' to the economy.
item.title: Recovery tsar eyes gas, tax and skills to get economy up and running

item.description: Anti-government demonstrators in masks and gloves maintained social distancing by protesting against government corruption from car convoys.
item.title: Seatbelts off, masks on: Lebanon's protesters shake fists from their cars

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: Wall Street's month-long rally has abruptly ended and the staggering collapse in oil prices has seemingly reawakened the bears.
item.title: Oil price plunge shatters markets' great complacency

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: CA chief Kevin Roberts has written to his counterpart at the supermarket giant to see if it can help make up for the loss of hours by cricket staff.
item.title: Going to market: Cricket Australia makes jobs plea to Woolworths for stood-down staff

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The former NRL chief executive said there will be "another chapter" in his first public statement since walking away from the game on Monday.
item.title: 'No regrets': Greenberg plans to remain NRL's 'biggest fan'

item.description: Former New England Patriots tight end turned wrestler Rob Gronkowski is set to join his former teammate Tom Brady at the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
item.title: 'I'm not totally done': Gronkowski pulls pin to reunite with Brady

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: Council elections should be postponed in Victoria due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Municipal Association of Victoria says.
item.title: Councils want local elections put on ice, say 'pros outweigh the cons'
